properties.name: Pioneer Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Pioneer Park

This is one of the most charming spots in the region for capturing sounds. Between the subtle squeaks of the old wooden swing and the variety of wildlife to be found in the area, rests a simple park. Overlooking the Puget Sound this is the perfect spot for sitting on the grass for a picnic with family.

properties.name: Sunnyside Beach Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Sunnyside Beach Park

This location present a wide biodiversity.

properties.name: Sunnyside Beach Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Sunnyside Beach Park

This location present a wide biodiversity.

properties.name: Chambers Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Chambers Creek Regional Park

While this exact location isn’t particularly accessible, a paved and elevated path to water is available nearby. It is a main attraction to both locals and international visitors alike, and acts as a welcoming space that is less hidden than the parks of Steilacoom.

properties.name: Chambers Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Chambers Creek Regional Park

More so than Tacoma or even Seattle, University Place parks have shown themselves to the cartographic-researcher to be a very popular international tourist spot. While the grasses of the golf course are still recovering from its hosting of the 2015 U.S. Open Golf Tournament, the area does hold potential for attracting niche crowds of wide diversities, and to serve as a site for international and local harmony to meet in amity.

properties.name: Titlow Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Titlow Park

At this park location on those sunny days especially, and after you grab some food from one of the small-local-restaurants, you can have an outdoor meal with your family on the small pier which also hosts picnic tables.

properties.name: Titlow Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Titlow Park

This University Place park is an essential component of the community. Facilitating families of both local and international origin, this park is nicely structured for experiencing a nice walk through nature after small meal.

properties.name: Point Defiance Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Point Definace Park

A man made waterfall dominates the recording here, and while for casual listeners it may be “louder than the others,” but this location serves very well for parents with young children. With the zoo nearby, this sonic design choice actually serves a quite productive purpose on many fronts.

properties.name: Cummings Park Official Site Link
properties.description:
Cummings Park

A location perfect for relaxing at, during an after-meal-walk… This park is a nice balance of train, river, and traffic noises in particular. The evening time is busy, but with enough space to allow for a picnic or scooter ride along the wide paths.

properties.name: Jack Hyde Official Site Link
properties.description:
Jack Hyde Park

Between the memorial park to the Chinese and the restaurants of the area you’ll find this spot. At higher points you’ll see people walking and resting with their dogs, while at lower points you’ll catch couples enjoying the sunset and summer air.
